1. Using `crossprod` is substantially faster

```{r}
x <- rnorm(100)
w <- runif(100)

bench::mark(
  weighted_means <- sum(x*w),
  weighted_means <- crossprod(x, w),
  check = F
)
```

2. The relative speed of `crossprod` increases as we increase the length of the vectors.

```{r}
x <- rnorm(100000)
w <- runif(100000)

bench::mark(
  weighted_means <- sum(x*w),
  weighted_means <- crossprod(x, w),
  check = F
)
```

3. 

```{r}
random_string <- function() {
  paste(sample(letters, 50, replace = TRUE), collapse = "")
}
strings <- replicate(10, random_string())

collapse <- function(xs) {
  out <- ""
  for (x in xs) {
    out <- paste0(out, x)
  }
  out
}

bench::mark(
  collapse(strings),
  paste(strings, collapse="")
)
```
